vypada to zajimave :)
comments.author: Anas Al-Sayed

captions.text: Hi, you would probably want to go eat,

and I have a tendency to give an hour-long
presentation in 15 minutes,
so this is probably going to be fast also.

Friends from TEDx called me, in my opinion,
because of the projects, that we do,
because I do none of them alone,

but because I have talked about them
quite often, I thought I was getting bored,

and since there's 700 of you here,
and I counted with those 4 exit doors,

you wouldn't be able to clear the room
in those 8 minutes, even if you wanted to,

so I would perhaps tell you something else,
things that , from my point of view,

are really ideas worth spreading,
or those that I would like to spread.

Since there are so many scientists here, I did a lot of
really extreme experiments also, as you can see,
and I wanted to look scientific also,

talking about things, that I don't like about Slovakia,
and about why we do the projects,

or why people around me do these projects,
and what is the biggest pain in the ass

and I found out that "they" are responsible,
that kind of pub-talks,

always them up there, they did something
bad, and we are innocent.
(laugh) (applause)

So I understood that they will not do
things nicer or better on our behalf,

every one of them is there because of his own
reasons and I will not analyze them now,

but perhaps we have to stop relying on them,
and even hoping that they will do something,

because they probably won't do
anything shortly, but I believe

that there will be a situation once,
when they will do something nice.
She won't do it for us,

he won't do it for us, even though it is
the coolest character in the world,

and those two won't do it for us, although one of them
has a really nice name. You can guess which one.
Since I wanted you to take me seriously,

I am probably the youngest speaker here,
so I wanted to give it such a form,

that this is really a serious thing.
Watch out for confetti.
1.50 euros. Don't buy such confetti.

And I came up with OPKS, which is
"Operational Programme Nicer Slovakia",

where we would manage to make nicer
Slovakia all by ourselves in 5 years,

and not just in terms of visual appearance,
but also generally nicer, better Slovakia

in 5 years, completely easy, without money
from eurofunds, without billions, without anything.

All by ourselves. And why
an operational programme?

As a young student Pavol said, it sounds
damn important, otherwise there's no other reason.
(laugh)

For such a programme you need: cool logo,
those confetti, 1000 pages of useless text,

or 10,000, it doesn't matter, there must be
some useless text,

and stickers, that, I'm afraid,
I didn't manage to print in time.
(applause)

And after this perplexed intro, when you thought,
what the hell this boy wanted here,

I will now proceed to those
5 real goals or problems,
that, I think, we should solve somehow,

for us to have better life
and really nicer Slovakia.

First of the things, that I generally
don't like about us, is apathy,

that is probably rooted
inside us in the long term,
maybe somehow even in the nation itself,

and that we got used to it after
those 20 years, and we often say,

that it is all useless, and that it perhaps
doesn't look the way we wanted,
and we just don't care to solve things.

And that is a big problem, because as soon
as that apathy grows into the kind of societal mood,
that I feel is in some areas even now,
things will never move forward.

And we really have to cover it,
and forget about it and move on.

The second thing that
we should make better,
is local action, or building of communities.

There are a few things
that we can look upon,

and, of course, one of them
is buying local food,

and these kind of things
that I don't want to go into,

but such details as --
I know people from Orava

who have never been to Orava Castle
on vacation, they haven't been there.

I know people from Poprad,
who haven't visited High Tatras,

and maybe this is one of the things,
that we should look into,

and another thing is, to be interested in
what's going on at our local governments.

Those are the things, that
have a real impact on us,

and I can say for myself, that I haven't been to
any meeting of local government in Námestovo,

and it is a mistake, I should go there and be interested in
what's going on there, and how the things are going to be.

And since I live in Bratislava now,
maybe I should be interested here,

I should go there and I should want to know,
what is going to happen.
So I have to get better at this also.

The third thing is the
professionalisation of society,
and it is related to the fact

that schools in Slovakia are not the best,
so some professions don't get enough credit

and we think that anybody can be
an architect and designer.

Being designer myself,
I perceive this more.

Very few of us go to the doctor, and
when he says: "You have a pneumonia,"

he starts arguing and say:
"No, doctor, that is an intestinal flu."

But with architecture, and design, and
many other professions we have a tendency

to have 5 million experts,
and we should realize,

that when there are certain professions,
we should respect them,

and it also relates to the fact, that
many people do things, they don't enjoy,

so they do them badly, they
spread some bad energy,

and after that it's just one big
merry-go-round, that doesn't work.

So if you do something you don't enjoy,
you should really think about

changing it, because you have
only one life, and it is an useless thing.

Another thing is, I dreadfully like people,
who have their own opinion,
and we have such people around us,

but I'm always fascinated by that
Slovak need to express it on everything.

If I was asked, whether those...
(applause)

As were said those genetic things in the morning,
if I was asked for my opinion,

I cannot say adequately, whether it is good
or bad, because that simply is not my topic.

But it seems like there is some kind of
societal consent, that I must say yes or no.
I just cannot say I don't know.

And it's not a sin to say
I don't know, when I don't know.

Fourth thing is money, whereas money forms the world
we live here and it cannot be changed somehow,

and maybe we should think more
about who we give them to,
since such a world we will live here then.

When we will keep on visiting restaurants,
where they will not give us fresh water for free,

such restaurants will keep on arising,
and they will think they do it well.

When we will keep on visiting restaurants,
where there is a bad waiting and even worse food,
such restaurants will keep on arising.

So we don't need to visit them and we should
let them go bankrupt, so new restaurants can arise,

that will be managed by people who will like them,
and who will do things as we like them.
Because it's the money that creates them.

That is also associated with
supermarkets and everything.

And the fifth thing, also very substantial,
is the national pride of some kind,

but not that style, where I put on a shirt with
double cross on it and I go march somewhere,

or I go beat somebody, there's no need
to beat anybody, just calm down,

sometimes all it takes is to act like the green patrol and pick
up trash, that is the most beautiful display of national pride.

Or when I go to the national part, I will not make a mess
there, I will not do things I am not supposed to do.

Or when I talk to somebody about Slovakia,
in addition to all the bitching for 20 minutes

I will also say something nice, because
if we alone think it's bad here,

the whole world will think about us the same.
So the pride can be done in a completely different way.

For us to make it all in 5 years, and we can do it in one,
it depends on your tiredness,

(laugh)
but for us to make it all in 5 years,

we must begin today,
but as my mother said,

an operational programme without a graph
is not an operational programme, I have a graph.
(laugh)
(applause)
Thanks.
(applause)

This really deserves an applause, because
these are strong statistical data...

(smiech)
It can be seen, that in 2016 is a small recession,

but we will kick it up nicely later.
(laugh)

As they say with start-ups, this one is
a hockey-stick-style graph,

Ivan Štefunko would know to explain, that in every
presentation there should be a hockey-stick-style graph,
that climbs upwards radically,

so we have one, and we can move forward.
(laugh)

A bit of inspiration, specific things we could do,
and they are damn simple:

Warning, I'm not going to say anything new.
(laugh)

These are all things we all know,
me too, but I don't do some of them,
and I want to get better at it.

Sometimes all it takes is to let a person with less
items at the counter in front of you,

which is a completely simple thing,
and it will make his day.

It is a total trifle, but it
really makes my day.
Go look at your local government,

what they do should be controlled, because if not,
they will do what they want,

if they see nobody cares,
as they do today.

Talk to your neighbour,
bake him a cake,

I won't bake a cake, because
he could take it as an assault...

(laugh)
But if you know how to, bake a cake.

Don't return to a bad restaurant,
really let it go bankrupt,

instead go 500 meters further or even
a kilometer, and go to that good restaurant,

because he will keep on doing it badly
for the rest of his life, if you keep on visiting it.

Wave at somebody from a car/train, that is
somewhat vicious, because you wave at him,

and he will not know the whole day
who you were... (laugh)

When you see something good happening
around you or some good initiative arises,

lend a hand, don't be afraid to go to them,
and say you like what they do.
Meet foreigners in Slovakia,

travel around Slovakia, that's what we lack a lot,
me too and I plan on improving that.

Talk about Slovakia, and of course nobody expects
us to talk we have the seventh heaven here,

but we also have nice and good things,
and sometimes when I hear abroad
talks about Slovakia from Slovaks to foreigners,

they talk like it is the greatest hell,
and in my opinion it is not,
or it yet can be.
Donate things you don't need.

Control the management of state
in fields you understand.

We tried it with that project of ours
"It cannot be done", since it is the thing
we operate in.

And if everyone just looked at what
our state spends money at,

a builder for example to look
at the highways, and say aloud that

"Well, this kerbstone for 5 million
crowns is probably not fitting,"

so they would see we are interested,
and they wouldn't do what they want,

because when they see we are apathetic,
they will do what they want absolutely,

and I have a feeling they are
headed this way already.

Go vote, and now I mean those local elections mainly,
because there's where you can really change something,

and also run for
those local governments,
so you can do some work.

When you go to some bureau, give the lady there
her second chance, when she acts like a bitch,

give her the third, because maybe she is ill... (laugh)
Maybe she has some ill kids at home,

but don't give the fourth chance and go complain
about her, because she maybe the one,

who suffers there, and when she
gets fired, she may find a job,

that she will enjoy, and she will not
have to meet anybody. (laugh)
(wild cheering)

Ask why, and as Vlado Gaštier
advised, ask 5 times,

because only then you will come
to the root of the problem.

And really simple things,
that are getting lost lately:

greet, beg, thank, smile, and it can be
nicer here without those eurofunds.
I too have a lot of work to do in many areas.

And if you want, visit www.opks.sk,
there you can subscribe for email reminders,

and we may inspire you from
time to time with something,

but mainly you can download there that 1000 pages long...
The brochure has 1005 pages.
(laugh)

1005 pages long brochure of
absolutely useless text, it is 3.5MB,
so you should definitely do that.
And as we talked about that president...
(laugh) (applause)

(wild cheer)
"OPKS deserves Slovakia"
Because I've found out,

it's kinda fashionable to have
as many candidates as possible,

and I would like to become also, but I can't,
because I'm still a nipper,

(laugh)
so that year, if possible, remember,

I have counted that I will
be able by that time...

(laugh)
So 2034, I would like to announce it in a little advance...

(laugh)
We'll see, if it works out,

and not to finish with such a crap,
(laugh)

I believe, that we really
can't blame anybody,

they will be up there,
doing what they want,

there will always be somebody, and we can
always find somebody who's the bad one.

But if we don't like it here, it is us
to be blamed, nobody else.

And we can make it nicer,
and I believe we know how,

and there's a lot of people here,
just that thing alone,

so let's make it all nicer for ourselves,
we are 20 years old, we're no longer 15...

(laugh)
Let's make a nicer Slovakia. Thank you.
(wild cheers)

title: Operational programme nicer Slovakia: Jakub Ptacin at TEDxBratislava 2013
